title: Linux mv Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux mv command and learn how to rename files, move multiple files, and perform other file management tasks with practical examples.

meta.title: Linux mv Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux mv command and learn how to rename files, move multiple files, and perform other file management tasks with practical examples.
meta.keywords: Linux, mv command, file management, rename file, move files, directory operations

verify.name: Verify file rename
verify.hint: The file 'file2.txt' should exist in the '~/project' directory after renaming 'file1.txt'.

verify.name: Verify file move
verify.hint: The file 'file1.txt' should exist in the '~/project/new_dir' directory after moving it.

verify.name: Verify file rename
verify.hint: The file 'renamed_file.txt' should exist in the '~/project' directory after renaming 'original_file.txt'.

steps.title: Move Multiple Files to a New Directory

verify.name: Verify files moved
verify.hint: The files 'file1.txt', 'file2.txt', and 'file3.txt' should exist in the '~/project/new_dir' directory after moving them.
